intro: Clutia similis, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clutia similis is also known for its medicinal properties, used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
